channel.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
channel.description:
i desided to make this as my first actually posted model ive made morejust havent decided to post them if u like this i will post more is first time i am new as said in title please dont flame me but give me tips and thing i should work on if you want me to i will release it (when i figure out how :O but in the mean time just tell me what u think :)
some pics
basic veiw of it [IMG]http://i1110.photobucket.com/albums/h446/darkknite385/armadyllongswordreg.jpg[/img] heres one being held by male model [IMG]http://i1110.photobucket.com/albums/h446/darkknite385/armadyllongswordinhand.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i1110.photobucket.com/albums/h446/darkknite385/armadyllongswordgoodangle.jpg[/img]
so yeah there it is tell me what you guys think silent cj you too watched your tuts for hours read your tut on here like 5 times now tell me if i did any gud XD

item.description:
@darkrush wrote:

im deciding to release it makes sum ints make nice spec for it do leach if change it a bit then release it gimmy credz for da blade but i wanna see what sumbody can do with my 2hours of work put in game or sumtin show it in screenies and stuff post em on this topic to or i probly wont see here they r armadyl lonswordb.dat.gz - 1 Kb and other one armadyl longsworddropb.dat.gz - 1 Kb there yu guys go hope your happy ima go make scope for meh mcmillian berret .50 cal now ;D ;D ;D

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @Mod_L Mod L
item.description:
@Mod_L wrote:

Well in my oppinion it is a great model, colours are nice, but maybe make the blade a little more white by the hilt and maybe a glow effect would be kickass? will u be releasing this…
anyway 9/10

Read full topic

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @darkrush darkrush
item.description:
@darkrush wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:20, topic:402741”][quote author=poopler40 link=topic=499798.msg3656522#msg3656522 date=1310063682]
This is a tip for all modelers in meta open you object property and change the angel in the apply smoothing tab from 59.5 to 120. It smooths the the models with out any extra poly. For this model it would smooth out the design on the blade and the handle.
[/quote]
All this does is render it how RuneScape renders their models.[/quote] its not just render i made the model and nothing bad so far i might release it scared sumbody gonna leach it and ill see like 2marrow with sumbody else saying the made it if you want me to release reply release to this topic

Read full topic

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

It doesn’t actually smooth the mesh. It just makes the model look like it has no edges. Seamless look, really. I prefer having hard surfacing.

Read full topic

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

exactly! aren’t runescape models smooth?

Read full topic

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

poopler40:

This is a tip for all modelers in meta open you object property and change the angel in the apply smoothing tab from 59.5 to 120. It smooths the the models with out any extra poly. For this model it would smooth out the design on the blade and the handle.

All this does is render it how RuneScape renders their models.

Read full topic

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

This is a tip for all modelers in meta open you object property and change the angel in the apply smoothing tab from 59.5 to 120. It smooths the the models with out any extra poly. For this model it would smooth out the design on the blade and the handle.

Read full topic

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @darkrush darkrush
item.description:
@darkrush wrote:

[quote=“kirikugi, post:16, topic:402741”]this is actuly a great looking model but is indeed triangulated and it seems the core line thingy in the blade has WAY to many lines or polys …
but also a concern of mine is seeing your new and when you first (posted) model is this good(compared to other starters) theres always a speculation of it not being yours or as we call a “leach” and if it is a leach the best way of avoiding confrontation is being honest[/quote]nope not a leach i did see things called like armadyl sword and longsword but i made this myself bcuz i didnt like other ones and though if i made one myself it would be pretty kool soo… here it is now posted on moparscape but ye ive seen new ppl do leaches i wuld have posted a long time ago but never understood how dis forum worked

Read full topic

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @kirikugi kirikugi
item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

this is actuly a great looking model but is indeed triangulated and it seems the core line thingy in the blade has WAY to many lines or polys …
but also a concern of mine is seeing your new and when you first (posted) model is this good(compared to other starters) theres always a speculation of it not being yours or as we call a “leach” and if it is a leach the best way of avoiding confrontation is being honest

Read full topic

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

It’s triangulated, which doesn’t help any of us. Your blade has quite an… interesting, frame. Rather messy. Take it from a straight on angle, not turned to the side like you have it.

item.title: Armadyl lonsword 1 (post im new)

item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“darkrush, post:9, topic:402741”][quote author=gnomez link=topic=499798.msg3655328#msg3655328 date=1309977336]
i like it did you make the hilt yourself or did you just take it off the godsword?

edit:

[quote author=darkrush link=topic=499798.msg3655239#msg3655239 date=1309974478]

[quote author=badger41 link=topic=499798.msg3655225#msg3655225 date=1309973980]

Looks pretty good,

Post a wireframe though
[/quote]lol couldnt figure out how i am new but tyvm

just printscreen the model in the workspace with the wireframe showing and post that
[/quote]wait what? how do i do that
whats a printscreen and were is it in metesequoia

printscreen is a key on your keyboard that says prt scr its usually above the backspace
[/quote]didnt work prtsrc dont do anyting darn[/quote]

you press the key and then paste the picture in paint and then save lol
